Column Comment.0: ENTITLEMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the row in the entitlement table.
Column Comment.1: ACCESS CONDITION: A textual description of the conditions for access to an object,in the case where this information is not to be validated. Note that the other tables inthis module allow more precise control.
Column Comment.2: ACCESS CONDITION CODE: a set of codified instructions regarding access to abusiness object.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: DESCRIPTION: a textual description of the type of entitlement.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.6: ENTITLEMENT_NAME: The name of the Entitlement.
Column Comment.7: ENTITLEMENT TYPE: the type of entitlement that is described in the row, such as aseismic lease data entitlement, a security based entitlement etc.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY ACTION: The action that must be undertaken when the entitlement expires.This may involve destruction or return of materials.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: PRIMARY TERM: The primary term for which this entitlement is in effect.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SECURITY DESCRIPTION: A narrative description of the security set on thisentitlement. Supplementary information may be stored in access condition and usecondition.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: USE CONDITIONS: Describes the uses that this object may be put to, based on theentitlement or security conditions.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
